articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Eli Harel was an Israeli soldier in his early thirties when he was sent into Lebanon in 2006 to battle fighters from the Iranian-backed group Hezbollah in a bloody, largely inconclusive month-long war.
articles.title: Residents of northern Israel brace for possible all-out war with Hezbollah

articles.author: Iryna Nazarchuk
articles.description: A Russian missile attack on an educational institution in a popular seafront park in the Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday killed at least five people and injured 32, local officials said.
articles.title: Russian missile hits educational institution, kills five in Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Tuesday that its air defence systems had shot down six U.S.-produced Army Tactical Missile Systems (ATACMS) launched by Ukraine over the last 24 hours.
articles.title: Russia shoots down six U.S.-made ATACMS missiles

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump’s hush money criminal trial is set to resume in New York on Tuesday with testimony from a banker familiar with accounts involved in the former U.S. president's alleged scheme to influence the 2016 election by covering up a sex scandal.
articles.title: Trump NYC hush money trial to resume with banker's testimony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 34,535 Palestinians have been killed and 77,704 wounded in the Israeli military offensive in the Gaza Strip since Oct. 7 last year, the Gaza health ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Gaza ministry says 34,535 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes since Oct. 7

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will carry out an operation against Hamas in the southern Gaza city of Rafah regardless of whether or not a ceasefire and hostage release deal is reached, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel will enter Rafah with or without Gaza hostage deal, Netanyahu says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A smiling and healthy-looking King Charles returned to public duties on Tuesday for the first time since he was diagnosed in February with cancer, paying a visit to a treatment centre for the disease in London.
articles.title: Smiling King Charles visits cancer centre on his return to public duties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's coast guard said on Monday it "expelled" a Philippine coast guard ship and another vessel from waters adjacent to the Scarborough Shoal, Chinese state media reported.
articles.title: China's coast guard expels Philippine vessels from Scarborough Shoal, state media says

articles.author: Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Elon Musk's surprise visit to China this week won concessions for Tesla but left India feeling spurned after he cancelled a scheduled trip there for earlier this month, with Indian commentators calling the move a snub.
articles.title: India 'shocked' as Musk's surprise China visit leaves them spurned

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia's Ruang volcano off the island of Sulawesi erupted on Tuesday, spewing ash and lava, after an eruption earlier this month led to hundreds of evacuations and an airport closure.
articles.title: Indonesia's Ruang volcano erupts again, alert status at highest
